title: Southern Europe
summary: Southern Europe is the southern subregion of Europe.[1] Definitions of Southern Europe, also known as Mediterranean Europe, may include countries and regions such as: Albania, Andorra, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus (politically and culturally, but belongs geographically to Western Asia), Gibraltar, Greece, Italy, Kosovo, Malta, Monaco, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Serbia, Slovenia, Southern France (especially Corsica), Spain, Turkey (East Thrace) and Vatican City.[2][3][4][5][6][7][8][9]
